title: Handle Fishing Line and Fish Safely at Sea
brief: Avoid injury when fishing and properly prepare fish to prevent spoilage and food poisoning.
steps: Step 1: Never handle fishing line with bare hands or wrap it around hands.
Step 2: Never tie fishing line to life raft.
Step 3: Wear gloves or use cloth to handle fish and avoid injury from sharp fins and gill covers.
Step 4: In warm regions, gut and bleed fish immediately after catching.
Step 5: Cut uneaten fish into thin, narrow strips and hang to dry.
Step 6: Use leftover fish or fish with dark meat as bait if not eaten immediately.
warnings: Salt on fishing line makes it sharp and dangerous to raft and hands.
Fish not cleaned and dried may spoil in half a day.
Never eat fish with pale/shiny gills, sunken eyes, flabby skin/flesh, or unpleasant odor.
Do not eat leftover fish with dark meat - very prone to decomposition.
